Article Title: Telecom minister Jyotiraditya Scindia: Local telecom manufacturing to provide more jobs....
Article Text:
6 SACs to offer insights to DoT

Union Minister of Communications Jyotiraditya Scindia said that local telecom manufacturing will generate more job opportunities at entry level, adding that it will also help in building up skilled manpower resources. The minister was speaking during a meeting with original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) in the telecom sector. He said that the government is focused on resolving issues in a time-bound manner and creating an industry-friendly process.“The initiative will be critical in engaging industry leaders in expanding and shaping the future of India's telecommunication ecosystem,” said the Ministry of Communications .The meeting was part of the recently-constituted Stakeholders Advisory Committee (SAC) with telecom sector OEMs. During the meeting, the minister discussed ways to stimulate indigenous manufacturing, adopting a pragmatic implementation approach, furthering ease of doing business and a review of issues taken up in an earlier meeting.The minister has constituted six distinct SACs to provide valuable insights to the Department of Telecom (DoT) on various matters pertaining to the telecom industry. These committees are aimed at facilitating a consistent two-way dialogue with the government on matters related to the telecommunication sector.At the meeting, minister Scindia assured the industry members of full government support in resolving issues raised by them, adding that OEMs are expected to present the best practices followed in other countries.Telecom equipment manufacturing sales cross Rs 50,000 croreAccording to the telecom ministry, the telecom equipment manufacturing sales in the country have crossed Rs 50,000 crore under the production-linked incentive (PLI) scheme. It has created more than 17,800 direct jobs and many more indirect jobs. The telecom equipment production exceeded the milestone of Rs 50,000 crore with exports at about Rs 10,500 crore, the ministry noted.
Article Summary: Jyotiraditya Scindia said that local telecom manufacturing will generate more job opportunities at entry level. The minister was speaking during a meeting with original equipment manufacturers (OEMs) in the telecom sector. The meeting was part of the recently-constituted Stakeholders Advisory Committee (SAC)

Article Title: Infosys’ Narayana Murthy, Mark Zuckerberg and 3 other tech leaders who spoke against work from home policy
Article Text:
NR Narayana Murthy, Infosys, co-founder

Sam Altman, CEO, OpenAI

Mark Zuckerberg, Facebook co-founder and Meta CEO

Elon Musk, Tesla CEO and X owner

Marc Benioff, Salesforce CEO

Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt recently said that Google has fallen behind the AI race because of its remote work policy – a remark for which he later expressed regret. However, he is not the only tech leader who has said that remote work has a negative influence on productivity. These leaders include Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy , Facebook-parent Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Tesla CEO Elon Musk , who have expressed concerns about the long-term viability of remote work.A notable mention is Schmidt who argued that remote work policy hindered Google's ability to innovate at the same pace as its competitors.“Google decided that work-life balance and going home early and working from home was more important than winning,” Schmidt said. However, Google requires in-person employee attendance for three-days-a-week.Here are 5 tech leaders who have thrown their weight behind and have publicly advocated for work from office, arguing that it fosters innovation, collaboration and company culture..At the Asia Economic Dialogue in Pune in February 2023, NR Narayana Murthy emphasised that “laziness” must be dealt with.“Please don't fall into this trap of ‘I will moonlight, I will do work from home , I will come to office three days in a week’," the tech leader said.Last year OpenAI CEO Sam Altman told Fortune Magazine that he believed one of the tech industry's “worst mistakes” was to allow employees to go "full remote forever.”“I would say that the experiment on that is over, and the technology is not yet good enough that people can be full remote forever, particularly on startups,” he told the magazine. The company, just like Google, the ChatGPT-maker also requires three days a week in-person attendance.Zuckerberg has also said that “people who work from home are not efficient and engineers who come to the office get more work done.”In 2023, Meta reportedly reversed the work-from-home policy, mandating that employees return to the office for at least three days a week.In 2023, Elon Musk called remote work "morally wrong" during an interview with CNBC.“I think that the whole notion of work from home is a bit like the fake Marie Antoinette quote, ’Let them eat cake’. It’s not just a productivity thing. I think it’s morally wrong,” Musk said.He added that engineers in the Silicon Valley are a part of “laptop classes living in la-la land” and said they should get off “their moral high horse work-from-home bulls***.”Salesforce CEO Marc Benioff last year told MSNBC that he loves remote work.“I'm a remote worker. I've always been a remote worker my whole life. I don't work well in an office,” he said.“For my people that's my message. They need to mix in person and remote together. Our engineers are extremely productive at home. We have lots of people who are extremely productive at home. But there also has to be sales people being productive in the office selling to customers and we need to make it all work,” Benioff said.
Article Summary: Infosys co-founder Narayana Murthy, Facebook-parent Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg and Tesla CEO Elon Musk have expressed concerns about the long-term viability of remote work. Former Google CEO Eric Schmidt recently said that Google has fallen behind the AI race because of its remote work policy.

Article Title: How Apple may be behind 900%-plus jump in this Tata Group company’s revenue
Article Text: Apple ’s expanding business in India has catalysed significant growth at Tata Electronics, propelling the homegrown company to a pivotal position within the global smartphone manufacturing industry. According to recent filings with the Registrar of Companies (RoC), as reported by The Economic Times, Tata Electronics witnessed an astounding ninefold increase in sales year-on-year, with revenues soaring to ₹3,802 crore in the previous fiscal year, up from ₹401 crore in FY23.This exponential growth can be largely attributed to Tata's strategic acquisition of Wistron 's iPhone assembly plant near Bengaluru, completed in March 2024. This move integrated Tata Electronics into Apple's global supply chain, establishing it as India's sole homegrown iPhone assembler.Looking ahead, Tata Electronics is poised for further expansion. The company is reportedly planning to establish a new iPhone assembly unit in Hosur, Tamil Nadu, with a substantial investment of ₹6,000 crore. This facility is expected to commence operations in November 2024 (Economic Times).Asides a newer facility, Financial Express had reported earlier this year that Tata Electronics was in talks to acquire a majority stake in Pegatron's India factory, another of Apple's contract manufacturers. The deal was expected post Lok Sabha Elections, by July-August, but so far there has been no word on it. If Tata closes on it, it could help the group further solidify its relations with Apple.Meanwhile, Apple is preparing to manufacture its high-end iPhone 16 Pro and Pro Max models in India for the first time this year, and that could further help Tata Electronics boost its financials . Bloomberg reports that Foxconn's factory in Tamil Nadu is already training workers to produce these premium devices, but soon Tata’s facility could also begin assembling Pro models, which per report, would mainly be exported outside of India.During a recent earnings call, Apple CEO Tim Cook underscored the company's success in India. He stated, "We set quarterly revenue records in more than two dozen countries and regions, including... India," highlighting the increasing significance of the Indian market in Apple's global strategy.
Article Summary: Tata Electronics witnessed an astounding ninefold increase in sales year-on- year. This exponential growth can be largely attributed to Tata's strategic acquisition of Wistron's iPhone assembly plant near Bengaluru, completed in March 2024. This move integrated Tata Electronics into Apple's global supply chain, establishing it as India's sole homegrown iPhone assembler.

Article Title: iPhone users in EU to get more control over default apps
Article Text:
Users can also delete Messages, Camera, and other core Apple apps

After introducing alternative app stores, now Apple is losing its grip over the default apps in the European Union, under the Digital Markets Act . iPhone and iPad users in the 27-nation bloc will soon be able to change the default apps for phone calls, messaging, and other core functions . This marks a significant shift in Apple's historically closed ecosystem approach.The changes, coming later this year in iOS 18 , will allow EU users to set third-party apps as the default for phone, messaging, keyboards, password managers, and call spam filters.In spring 2025, Apple plans to extend this to navigation and translation apps as well.A new "Default Apps" section in Settings will give users a centralised place to manage these preferences. This expands on existing options to change default browsers and email apps that Apple introduced in 2020.Additionally, EU users will be able to delete previously unremovable core apps like the App Store, Messages, Camera, Photos, and Safari. Only the Settings and Phone apps will remain undeletable.These changes come as Apple works to comply with the EU's Digital Markets Act (DMA), which aims to increase competition in digital markets. The company has already opened up its App Store to third-party marketplaces in the EU, withEpic Games launching its store on iOS last week.Apple is also tweaking its browser choice screen that appears when EU users first open Safari. The new design will require users to scroll through all options before selecting, and will display more information about each browser.While these changes only apply to EU users for now, they could potentially expand to other regions in the future, as regulators worldwide scrutinise big tech companies' practices, including that of Apple.
Article Summary: iPhone and iPad users in the 27-nation bloc will soon be able to change the default apps for phone calls, messaging, and other core functions. A new "Default Apps" section in Settings will give users a centralised place to manage these preferences. Apple plans to extend this to navigation and translation apps in spring 2025.

Article Title: Zomato shuts down 2-year-old Legends service, here's what CEO Deepinder Goyal said
Article Text:
Zomato Xtreme hyperlocal goods delivery service shut down in July



Zomato has announced the shutdown of its ' Legends ' service, which offers iconic dishes from various Indian cities. The decision follows a temporary suspension which was imposed by the company on the service earlier this year. Despite Zomato’s efforts to make the 'Legends' service successful, the company's inability to meet market demands led to the decision to terminate the service.Launched in 2021, 'Legends' aimed to deliver renowned local cuisine to customers across the country.In an X post, Zomato CEO Deepinder Goyal confirmed the company’s decision. He said: "After two years of trying and not finding product-market fit, we have decided to shut down the service with immediate effect."The Zomato Legends service allowed customers to order an item from a city far away. For example, this service allowed users to order biryani from a restaurant in Kolkata sitting in Delhi.After temporarily suspending it in April, Zomato restarted the ‘Intercity Legends’ service last month. The company also increased the minimum order value to Rs 5,000 to make each delivery more profitable than earlier.In July, Zomato suspended its hyperlocal goods delivery service 'Xtreme' which was launched a year ago. With this service, the food delivery platform wanted to compete with intracity small package delivery service providers Shadowfax, Porter and Loadshare. The company also removed the dedicated Xtreme app from the Google Play Store.This service aimed to leverage Zomato's existing delivery network to provide intracity package deliveries across nearly all of the 750-800 cities where the company offers food delivery service.In a statement to The Economic Times, a company executive said that the Xtreme service is being discontinued on account of poor demand.“It was an experiment...a lot of restaurants do direct delivery and the company's feedback was that restaurants wanted a similar quality of experience for direct deliveries. That was the basis on which Xtreme was rolled out. But it was always an experiment and could have swung either way,” the company executive noted.
Article Summary: Zomato has announced the shutdown of its'Legends'service, which offers iconic dishes from various Indian cities. The decision follows a temporary suspension which was imposed by the company on the service earlier this year. Zomato also suspended its hyperlocal goods delivery service 'Xtreme' which was launched a year ago.

Article Title: Disney+ Hotstar to stream select Premier League 2024/25 matches in 4K
Article Text: Disney+ Hotstar, the official streaming partner for the Premier League 2024/25 in India, has announced that it will broadcast select matches in 4K resolution. This marks the first time Premier League games will be available in 4K streaming quality in India, offering fans an unprecedented viewing experience.The streaming service plans to air over 100 matches in 4K throughout the season on 4K-enabled Living Room (LR) devices.This feature will be accessible to Disney+ Hotstar premium subscribers through the English language audio feed.The Premier League 2024/25 season kicked off on August 17 with Manchester United facing Fulham.The league, considered the pinnacle of English football , features 20 clubs competing in a promotion and relegation system. Each team plays 38 matches per season, running from August to May, with games primarily scheduled on weekends and occasional midweek fixtures.
Article Summary: Disney+ Hotstar is the official streaming partner for the Premier League 2024/25 in India. The streaming service plans to air over 100 matches in 4K throughout the season on 4K-enabled Living Room (LR) devices. The feature will be accessible to premium subscribers through the English language audio feed. The league, considered the pinnacle of English football, kicked off on August 17.

Article Title: Meta and Snap could unveil their new AR glasses in September
Article Text: Meta and Snap are gearing up to showcase their latest augmented reality (AR) glasses next month. According to The Verge's Command Line newsletter, both companies will unveil their new AR devices at separate events in September.Snap CEO Evan Spiegel is expected to reveal the fifth generation of Spectacles on September 17 at the annual Partner Summit in Los Angeles.Just over a week later, on September 25, Meta's Mark Zuckerberg will debut the company's first AR glasses , codenamed Orion , at the Connect conference in Menlo Park.Despite the high-profile announcements, neither company plans to make these devices available for public purchase. The Command Line newsletter reports that Snap will produce fewer than 10,000 units, distributing them to select developers and partners, similar to their strategy in 2021. Meta is manufacturing even fewer of its Orion glasses.The limited production is largely due to the high costs associated with manufacturing these advanced devices. Snap's latest Spectacles are expected to cost several thousand dollars per unit to produce, while Meta's Orion glasses reportedly required billions in development costs.Both companies are grappling with the challenge of making AR technology ready for mainstream adoption. The new Spectacles are said to feature improvements over the previous generation, including a larger field of view and longer battery life. Meta's CTO Andrew Bosworth has described their Orion glasses as potentially "the most advanced piece of technology on the planet in its domain."
Article Summary: Snap and Meta will unveil their latest augmented reality (AR) glasses next month. Neither company plans to make these devices available for public purchase. Snap will produce fewer than 10,000 units, distributing them to select developers and partners. Meta's Orion glasses reportedly required billions in development costs.

Article Title: Google launches Pixel 9 Pro Fold, it’s first-ever foldable phone in India
Article Text:
Pixel 9 Pro Fold has bigger and brighter displays

Tensor G4, Gemini and more AI inside

Upgraded cameras with the new 'Add me' AI feature for photos

Google has launched its second-generation Pixel foldable phone, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold , which is its first-ever foldable phone in India. The second-gen Pixel Fold upgrades on some salient aspects over the first one. Per Google, the foldable is slim, super durable, and has a brighter screen, both on the outside and inside. And, the phone also packs in Pixel’s “fastest, most powerful” Tensor G4 chip , bringing on-device multimodal capabilities to the phone.On the inside, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold comes equipped with an 8 inches ‘Super Actua Flex display,’ an LTPO panel with a 2922x1344 resolution at 486 PPI. The inner screen has a dynamic refresh rate of 1-120Hz and can go as bright as 3,000 nits, which Google says is 80% brighter than the screen on the first-gen Pixel Fold. To make use of phone’s large inner canvas, there’s a split-screen mode that’ll let you use two apps side-by-side.When unfolded, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold can be used a regular phone with a 6.3 inches outer screen, which has the same specs as the inner screen.Google says that the Pixel 9 Pro Fold has an “all-new” hinge that is made from stainless steel and has an aerospace grade aluminium alloy cover. The hinge has a polished finish, while the back has the silky matt finish. The phone is rated IPX8 for water resistivity. And there’s Gorilla Glass Victus 2 on the outside.Powering the Pixel 9 Pro Fold is Google’s Tensor G4 chip, also found on the other three Pixel 9 phones. The chip comes paired with 16GB of RAM and up to 1TB storage. Then, there’s theTitan M2 security coprocessor , which enables multi-layer hardware security.There’s a 5,060mAh battery, which Google promises will last for over 24 hours and up to 100 hours with Extreme Battery Saver. The phone supports fast charging at 45W, which should fill up the battery up to 55% in about 30 minutes. FYI, the charger isn’t included in the box. The phone also supports Qi wireless charging and Battery Share, i.e., reverse wireless charging.Out-of-the-box the Pixel 9 Pro Fold will come with Android 14 . There’s the usual Google promise of 7 years of OS and security updates.Would it even be a Pixel phone, if there’s no AI in it. Well, there’s a whole lot of AI. For starters Gemini is there, and it works in split-screen mode, as well. One could ask Gemini to write stuff or even get info about whats’s on the screen or photos. Circle To Search is also there, ohh and this feature can help you check if an image has been created using AI.The new “Pixel-exclusive” AI feature to arrive is Pixel Screenshots. The feature could organise or recall things, like events and location, all you need to is ask the phone.Google is giving one year of the Google One AI Premium plan for free to those who’ll buy the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. So, that’ll give you access to Gemini Advanced, Gemini in Gmail and Docs, on top of 2TB of cloud storage.The Pixel 9 Pro Fold ditches the camera visor for a squircle module that houses a triple lens setup – a 50MP wide camera, a 48MP ultraide and a 48MP 5x telephoto camera. For selfies, there's a 42 MP front-facing camera on the inner screen and 10MP camera on the outside.The camera hardware has been only a part of Pixel’s camera, but it’s AI that completes it. There’s a long list of AI features that complements the camera hardware on the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. The usual Super Res Zoom, Zoom Enhance, Video Boost, Face Unblur, Photo Unblur, Best Take, Magic Eraser, Audio Eraser, and Magic Editor makes their return. Well, Magic Eraser now has an a “reimagine” feature that Google says can give photos a “whole new look.”One new AI tool to come to Google’s Pixel 9 pro Fold is the “Add Me,” which as you’d image can add you to a picture. So, how does it work? Well, you take photo with the group, swap in yourself, and AI will merge the photos.Google Pixel 9 Pro Fold is priced in India at Rs 1,72,999 and will be available for purchase later this year. While it comes in two colours – Obsidian and Porcelain – it’ll be available only in Obsidian colour in India.
Article Summary: Google has launched its second-generation Pixel foldable phone, the Pixel 9 Pro Fold. The second-gen Pixel Fold upgrades on some salient aspects over the first one. Per Google, the foldable is slim, super durable, and has a brighter screen, both on the outside and inside. And, the phone also packs in Pixel’s “fastest, most powerful” Tensor G4 chip.

Article Title: General Motors lays off over 1,000 employees, including hundreds of software engineers; says “grateful to …
Article Text:
Job cuts come after the change of leadership

GM recently faced a few software incidents

General Motors is laying off more than 1,000 salaried employees globally in its software and services division, the company confirmed on Monday. The job cuts , which include about 600 positions at GM's tech campus near Detroit, come as part of a review to streamline operations in the unit."As we build GM's future, we must simplify for speed and excellence, make bold choices, and prioritise the investments that will have the greatest impact," GM said in a statement to CNBC.The layoffs represent approximately 1.3% of GM's global salaried workforce of 76,000 as of the end of 2023. The cuts primarily affect the automaker's US operations. Impacted employees were notified Monday morning."We are grateful to those who helped establish a strong foundation that positions GM to lead moving forward," the automaker added in its statement."As a result, we're reducing certain teams within the Software and Services organisation," GM stated. The division, currently led by executives Baris Cetinok and Dave Richardson, covers areas such as vehicle infotainment, OnStar services, and GM's Super Cruise advanced driver-assist system.The change comes less than six months after leadership shifts in the unit, including the departure of former Apple executive Mike Abbott in March due to health reasons.The job cuts follow GM's efforts to reduce costs amid industry concerns of a potential downturn and significant investments in electric vehicles and software-defined vehicles. GM has recently faced challenges with software issues in its new Chevy Blazer EV, including blank infotainment screens and charging error messages. The company issued a stop sale notice last December due to these problems, which was lifted in March.The layoffs also come after GM cancelled its "Ultra Cruise" programme, a competitor to Tesla's Full Self-Driving system, in January. The company merged the FSD team with its regular Super Cruise team.Despite the layoffs and recent setbacks, the company says it continues to work on expanding its hands-free driving system, with plans to broaden its capabilities by the end of 2025.
Article Summary: GM is laying off more than 1,000 salaried employees globally in its software and services division. The job cuts come as part of a review to streamline operations in the unit. The layoffs represent approximately 1.3% of GM's global salaries of 76,000 as of the end of 2023.

Article Title: Elon Musk reacts to ‘DOGE’ post about Donald Trump’s cabinet offer: Perfect name
Article Text: Former President Donald Trump mentioned he would consider Elon Musk for a significant role in his administration if re-elected. Musk reacted positively to a social media post suggesting he head the 'Department Of Government Efficiency (DOGE)'.

Musk reacted positively to a social media post suggesting he head the 'Department Of Government Efficiency (DOGE)’ He said he would be 'honoured' to be considered.

Article Title: British YouTuber Miles Routledge: I might ‘throw’ nuclear bomb on India, just for the sake ...
Article Text:
How the YouTuber reacted to the troll’s comments



“Saar your mum after I do my shift at Uber screams that at night btw saar, please saar, harder saar, I spit on the bitch and all she says is thaank sou saar. I don't shower saar and women don't talk to me saar. I work at Tim Hortons saar.”

“Believe it or not, I just don't like India. Also I can sense an Indian, he is Indian. If a man online suddenly talks about ducking your mother in the first response, he's Indian. Many such cases.”

A UK-based YouTuber named Miles Routledge has faced backlash after he made several racist remarks targeting Indians on the social media platform X (earlier Twitter). It all started with a meme video that he uploaded on X as a joke. The video showed alleged nuclear missiles coming out of hidden silos in the US and a worldwide nuclear war.While sharing the video he wrote: “When I become prime minister of England, I'll open the nuclear silos as an explicit warning to any foreign power that interferes with British interests and affairs.I'm not talking huge incidents, I'm itching to launch and atomise entire nations over the smallest infraction.”A few minutes later Routledge added a comment to the post as he said: “Hell, I might just launch at India just for the sake of it!”After sharing the post, he also responded to the comments made from a troll account which is now unavailable.“Saar I will see you soon saar,” Routledge said replying to the troll's commentsIn another reply, Routledge wrote:He also started receiving threatening DMs from the troll. Assuming that the trolling account may belong to an Indian, he started replying to the X profile with racist remarks against Indians. He shared a screenshot of DMs shared between him and the troll.“Indian threatens to find me, it backfires lmao,” he wrote captioning the screenshot. The image also included the YouTuber’s location and description of his clothes as he challenged the troll to come find him. Since then, the post has received more than 5 million views.In separate posts, he also shared his entire conversation as well as the profile details of the trolling account (which later became unavailable) on the platform.Here’s the full conversation between Routledge and the troll:Routledge’s remarks against Indians have drawn criticism. When another X user accused him of rage-baiting, he explained why he thought the troll threatening him was an Indian.He wrote:
Article Summary: UK-based YouTuber Miles Routledge has faced backlash after he made several racist remarks targeting Indians on the social media platform X (earlier Twitter) It all started with a meme video that he uploaded on X as a joke. The video showed alleged nuclear missiles coming out of hidden silos in the US and a worldwide nuclear war.

Article Title: Apple re-releases iOS 17.6.1 that fixes this important security issue on iPhones
Article Text:
How to install iOS 17.6.1

Apple has released an updated version of iOS 17.6.1 . The update comes almost 10 days after the company first released iOS 17.6.1. The latest release has a build number of 21G101. It brings a fix for an issue that prevented users from enabling or disabling Advanced Data Protection .To install the iOS 17.6.1 update on your iPhone , head to Settings. Here, tap on General and then tap on ‘Software Update’.As per Apple release notes, “This update includes important bug fixes and addresses an issue that prevents enabling or disabling Advanced Data Protection”.Apple explains: “Advanced Data Protection is designed to maintain end-to-end encryption for shared content as long as all participants have Advanced Data Protection enabled. This level of protection is supported in most iCloud sharing features, including iCloud Shared Photo Library, iCloud Drive shared folders and shared Notes.”It must be noted here that the Advanced Data Protection bug impacted a small number of iPhone users . Due to the bug, those enabling the Advanced Data Protection feature were seeing an error message, although it was turned on in the iCloud data.In a separate news, Apple has rolled out the fourth public beta of iOS 18. The release comes as the company nears the launch of 2024 iPhone 16 series and public roll out of iOS 18. The iOS 18 public beta 4 brings a host of new features along with some bug fixes and system stability improvements. These include bringing Bluetooth as individual control in the Control Centre, splash screens in apps like Home, Photos, Notes, and more.
Article Summary: The update comes almost 10 days after the company first released iOS 17.6.1. It brings a fix for an issue that prevented users from enabling or disabling Advanced Data Protection. In a separate news, Apple has rolled out the fourth public beta of iOS 18.

Article Title: Oppo A3 with 50MP camera, 45W fast charging launched, priced at Rs 15,999
Article Text:
Price and availability

Oppo

A3 specifications

Oppo A3 smartphone is here. Oppo has expanded its A-series of smartphones with the launch of the affordable Oppo A3 smartphone in India. The smartphone comes with military grade shock resistance and houses a 120Hz bright display. Oppo A3 comes with 45W fast charging support and runs Android 14 operating system. Oppo A3 comes with a price tag of Rs 15,999 and it can be purchased in Nebula Red and Ocean Blue colour options.The smartphone is available online on the company’s official website .Oppo A3 houses a 6.6-inch HD display with 720x1604 pixel resolution. The display offers 120Hz refresh rate and 89.9% screen-to-body ratio. The smartphone is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset paired with 6GB of RAM.Oppo A3 packs 128GB internal storage which can be expanded further by installing a microSD card. The affordable Oppo smartphone runs Android 14 operating system topped with the company's own layer of ColorOS on top.The dual SIM Oppo smartphone comes with military-grade shock resistance design. The company claims that the Oppo A3 can withstand shock and drop. The smartphone also comes with multiple liquid resistance which means that the smartphone will not get damaged even if it gets in touch with different kinds of liquids.Oppo A3 sports 50MP dual rear camera setup and a 5MP front camera for selfies. The smartphone is backed by a 5,100 mAh battery which comes with 45W fast charging support.
Article Summary: Oppo A3 comes with a price tag of Rs 15,999 and it can be purchased in Nebula Red and Ocean Blue colour options. Oppo A3 houses a 6.6-inch HD display with 720x1604 pixel resolution. The smartphone is powered by an octa-core MediaTek Dimensity 6300 chipset paired with 6GB of RAM.

Article Title: GoPro lays off 15% of its workforce, affecting 140 employees
Article Text:
Job cuts to be completed by year end

Second layoff in 2024

GoPro lays off 15% of its workforce this year, reported news agency Reuters. The popular action camera maker in a SEC filing said that it plans to cut its workforce as part of a restructuring plan to reduce operating expenses.“Restructuring Plan is anticipated to entail a reduction in force of approximately 15% from our ending second quarter headcount of 925 full-time employees beginning in Q3 2024,” the company said in the filing.The layoffs are expected to begin in the third quarter of 2024 and would be completed by the end of 2024. About 140 employees will be impacted by it.As part of the restructuring plan, the company expects to take charges in the range of $5 million to $7 million, with cash expenses of $1 million to be recognized in the third quarter and about $4 million to $6 million in the fourth quarter of 2024.This is the second time GoPro has announced job cuts in 2024. The company reduced its workforce by 4% in March earlier this year.GoPro had 925 full-time employees at the end of the second quarter ended June 30.Earlier this month, GoPro reported a revenue of $186 million for the second quarter, down 22.7% compared to last year. In May, the U.S. International Trade Commission launched a probe into GoPro's claims that patents for its cameras, systems and accessories were being violated by Chinese firm Arashi Vision.The tech industry continues to see job cuts in 2024. Last week, Cisco announced it would lay off 6,000 employees. In a separate news today, General Motors laid off more than 1,000 salaried employee in its software and services division.
Article Summary: GoPro plans to cut its workforce as part of a restructuring plan to reduce operating expenses. The layoffs are expected to begin in the third quarter of 2024 and would be completed by the end of 2024. About 140 employees will be impacted by it. The company reduced its workforce by 4% in March earlier this year.

Article Title: Google Imagine-3 AI-powered “highest quality text-to-image model” is available in this country
Article Text:
How to access Imagen-3

Google paused image-generation in Gemini chatbot

Google has released Imagen 3 , the latest iteration of its text-to-image AI model, to users in the US. The AI model promises significant improvements over its predecessor and is said to be “highest quality text-to-image model” offered by the tech giant.Imagen 3, accessible through Google's AI Test Kitchen , is designed to generate images with enhanced detail and more realistic lighting.By refining its AI capabilities, Google aims to deliver even more impressive and visually appealing image creations."We introduce Imagen 3, a latent diffusion model that generates high quality images from text prompts. We describe our quality and responsibility evaluations. Imagen 3 is preferred over other state-of-the-art (SOTA) models at the time of evaluation. In addition, we discuss issues around safety and representation, as well as methods we used to minimise the potential harm of our models," the company said in a research paper last week.Imagen 3 will be available in multiple versions, each optimised for different types of tasks, from generating quick sketches to high-resolution images.“Imagen 3 is our highest quality text-to-image model, capable of generating images with even better detail, richer lighting and fewer distracting artefacts than our previous models. We’ve significantly improved Imagen 3’s ability to understand prompts, which helps the models generate a wide range of visual styles and capture small details from longer prompts,” Google said about Imagen-3 when it launched the model at Google I/O this year.If you live in the US, you can access Imagen 3 via ImageFX and Vertex AI. Those living outside the US can register for it using this link . Your email will be added to the waiting list and you will be given access when the AI model is available in your country.Earlier this year, Google Gemini Al chatbot created factually incorrect images. Google acknowledged issues, which led to the temporary suspension of its image generation capabilities. Google CEO Sundar Pichai also said that the company is developing the feature from the ground up and fixing the issues.
Article Summary: Imagen-3 is the latest version of Google's text-to-image AI model. It is available to users in the US and is designed to generate images with enhanced detail and more realistic lighting. It will be available in multiple versions optimised for different types of tasks, from generating quick sketches to high- resolution images.

Article Title: Google Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro, Pixel 9 Pro XL with Gemini AI launched: Price in India, specifications and more
Article Text:
Google Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL price in India, availability

Google Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL specifications

Google Pixel 9

Google Pixel 9 Pro

Google Pixel 9 Pro XL

Read More |

Google Pixel 9 series is now official. The tech giant has launched the Google Pixel 9 , Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL in India with a suite of AI features across productivity apps and the camera. This will be the first Pixel smartphone to run Gemini Nano multimodal AI model on device.Google Pixel 9, Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL are price start at Rs 79,999, Rs 1,09,999, and Rs 1,24,999, respectively.The smartphones will be available in four colour options. The Pixel 9 is launched in Obsidian, Porcelain, Wintergreen and Peony colour options. The Pixel 9 Pro and Pixel 9 Pro XL are launched in Obsidian, Porcelain, Hazel and Rose Quartz colours.Google Pixel 9 and Google Pixel 9 Pro XL will be available for preorder starting August 14 and will go on sale on August 22. Details about the pre-orders and availability of the Pixel 9 Pro will be available later this year. The available smartphones can be purchased from Flipkart, and Croma as well as Reliance Digital offline stores.Google Pixel 9 sports a 6.3-inch Actua display with a peak brightness of 2,700 nits. The full-HD (1080 x 2424 pixels at 422 PPI) OLED display has 20:9 aspect ratio and 60-120Hz refresh rate. The display is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2.Under the hood is Google Tensor G4 SoC that is specially designed to handle AI and machine learning tasks. There is a Titan M2 security coprocessor, 12GB RAM and up to 256GB storage.As far as the camera is concerned, the phone gets a 50MP Octa PD wide camera with ƒ/1.68 aperture and 82-degree field of view. There is an ultrawide camera that packs a 48MP Quad PD sensor with an ultrawide lens that has ƒ/1.7 aperture and 123-degree field of view.On the front is a 10.5MP Dual PD selfie camera with autofocus, ƒ/2.2 aperture and 95-degree field of view. Other features include single-zone LDAF sensor, spectral and flicker sensor, and optical + electronic image stabilisation on the wide angle camera.Google is also bringing a bunch of AI features including: Super Res Zoom up to 8x, Add Me, Macro Focus, Night Sight, Astrophotography, Portrait Mode, Face Unblur, Long Exposure, Action Pan and Real Tone. Editing Features include Magic Editor, Magic Eraser, Best Take and Photo Unblur.The Google Pixel 9 packs a 4,700mAh battery and IP68 dust and water resistance rating. The smartphone will come preloaded with Android 14. Google is offering 7 years of OS, security, and Pixel Drop updates.Google Pixel 9 sports a 6.3-inch Super Actua display with a peak brightness of 3,000 nits and 1280 x 2856 pixels resolution. It is an LTPO OLED panel with 495 ppi, 20:9 aspect ratio and 1Hz-120Hz refresh rate. The display is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2.The smartphone is powered by Google Tensor G4 SoC that is specially designed to handle AI and machine learning tasks. There is a Titan M2 security coprocessor, 16GB RAM and up to 512GB storage.Coming to the camera, the Pixel 9 Pro sports a 50MP Octa PD wide camera with ƒ/1.68 aperture and 82-degree field of view. There is an ultrawide camera that packs a 48MP Quad PD sensor with an ultrawide lens that has ƒ/1.7 aperture and 123-degree field of view.There is a third telephoto camera 48MP Quad PD sensor paired with a lens that has ƒ/2.8 aperture, 22-degree field-of-view, 5x optical zoom and Super Res Zoom up to 30x.On the front is a 42MP Dual PD selfie camera with autofocus, ƒ/2.2 aperture and 103-degree field of view. Other features are similar to the Pixel 9. The phone packs a 4,700mAh battery and IP68 dust and water resistance rating, will come preloaded with Android 14 and will get 7 years of OS, security, and Pixel Drop updates.The largest of the trio, Google Pixel 9 Pro XL sports a 6.8-inch Super Actua display with a peak brightness of 3,000 nits and 1344 x 2992 pixels resolution. It is an LTPO OLED panel with 486 ppi, 20:9 aspect ratio and 1Hz-120Hz refresh rate. The display is protected by Corning Gorilla Glass Victus 2.The SoC and camera specifications are the same as the Pixel 9 Pro. There is a Google Tensor G4 SoC, paired with a Titan M2 security coprocessor, 16GB RAM and up to 512GB storage. The Pixel 9 Pro XL gets a 50MP Octa PD wide camera, a 48MP Quad PD ultrawide shooter and a 48MP Quad PD telephoto camera.The phone gets a 42MP Dual PD selfie camera, packs a 5,060mAh battery and comes with IP68 dust and water resistance rating. Both the Pro models come with Ultra-Wideband chip for accurate ranging and spatial orientation.
Article Summary: Google Pixel 9 and Pixel 9 Pro will be available for preorder starting August 14 and will go on sale on August 22. The Google Pixel 9 sports a 6.3-inch Super Actua display with a peak brightness of 3,000 nits and 1280 x 2856 pixels resolution. The phone is powered by Google Tensor G4 SoC that is specially designed to handle AI and machine learning tasks.

Article Title: Court: Burger King has "miserably failed" to prove trademark infringement case against Pune restaurant
Article Text:
Court says no to monetary damages to Pune eatery

In a surprising verdict, a Pune district court has dismissed a 13-year-old lawsuit filed by the American fast-food chain Burger King Corporation against a locally-owned eatery with the same name. The US company had accused the Pune-based Burger King of trademark infringement and sought a permanent injunction, damages, and a halt to the use of the name. The court dismissed the lawsuit filed by the Burger King Corporation in 2011, seeking a permanent injunction restraining infringement of trademark.However, the court ruled in favor of the local eatery, stating that it had been operating under the name "Burger King" since 1991-92, well before the US chain entered the Indian market.The plaintiff's first Indian BURGER KING restaurant was opened in New Delhi on November 9, 2014, the court said.The court found no evidence to support Burger King Corporation's claim that customers were confused or misled by the local eatery's use of the name. Additionally, the company failed to prove any actual financial loss due to the alleged infringement. The court said the Burger King Corporation has "miserably failed" to prove that the eatery here had infringed its trademark Burger King while running the restaurant in Pune.Burger King filed the lawsuit against Anahita Irani and Shapoor Irani. The Iranis opposed the suit, saying it was filed with malafide intentions and to discourage business people who are bonafide users and retailers. They said that apart from the name Burger King, there was absolutely no similarity in the plaintiff's trademark and their own shop name.This decision may have implications for trademark disputes involving established local businesses and multinational corporations.The Pune-based restaurant owners had counterclaimed for damages due to the harassment they endured during the lengthy legal battle. They sought Rs 20 lakh as damages. The court, however, refused any monetary relief to them too, noting that apart from oral evidence, no other proof was submitted to substantiate their claims.
Article Summary: Pune court dismisses 13-year-old lawsuit filed by Burger King Corporation. US company accused Pune-based Burger King of trademark infringement. Court ruled in favor of local eatery, saying it had been operating under the name since 1991-92.

How to use Indian Bike Driving 3D Cheat Codes

Begin by starting the Indian Bike Driving 3D game on your device.

Look for the button featuring a phone icon, typically located at the bottom left corner of the game screen. Click on this icon to open the phone menu.

Within the phone menu, find the handset icon, usually coloured green and positioned in the middle. Click on this icon to proceed.

Upon clicking the handset icon, a contact list will appear on the screen. Look for an icon featuring nine orange circles at the bottom left corner of this screen. Click on it to access the number entry interface.

In the number entry interface, use your device's keypad to input one of the provided cheat codes. Each cheat code corresponds to a specific reward mentioned in the description.

After entering the cheat code, press the confirm or enter button on your device's keypad. This action will immediately grant you the corresponding benefit associated with that cheat code.

Article Title: Vivo V40 with ZEISS co-engineered camera system goes on sale: Price in India, specifications and more
Article Text:
Vivo V40: Price, availability in India

Vivo V40 launch offers

Offline:

6 months of free accidental and liquid damage along with flat 10% instant cashback

12 months zero down payment

Up to 40% off on vivo V-Shield and up to 10% Exchange bonus as part of vivo upgrade programme with SBI, HDFC, Kotak Mahindra, and IDFC First Bank among other partners

Online:

6 months of free accidental and liquid damage along with flat 10% instant cashback

Flat 10% exchange bonus along with up to 6 months no-cost EMI

Vivo V40, V40 Pro: specifications, features

Vivo V40 smartphone is now available for purchase in India. It was launched in the country earlier this month alongside the V40 Pro and comes with ZEISS-style portrait modes as well as the Aura light flash.The V40 is priced at Rs 34,999 for the 8GB + 128GB variant, Rs 36,999 for the 8GB + 256GB variant and Rs 41,999 for the 12GB + 512GB variant. The phone will be available in Ganges Blue, Lotus Purple and Titanium Grey colour variants from Flipkart, Vivo India e-store and all partner retail stores.Launch offers include free accidental and liquid damage protection for six months, cashback options, and various financing schemes, available both online and offline.Vivo V40 sports a 6.78-inch 1.5K AMOLED display with a 120Hz refresh rate and up to 4500 nits peak brightness. The phone is powered by a Snapdragon 7 Gen 3 SoC.The phone comes with ZEISS Co-Engineered Camera System which includes a 50MP main rear camera with OIS and ZEISS optics, complemented by a 50MP ultra-wide camera and a 50MP 2x telephoto portrait camera.The phone also has an IP68 rating for dust and water resistance, packs a 5,500mAh battery with 80W fast charging and runs on Android 14 with Funtouch OS 14. The company has promised three Android updates and four years of security updates for the V40 series.
Article Summary: Vivo V40 is priced at Rs 34,999 for the 8GB + 128GB variant. The phone will be available in Ganges Blue, Lotus Purple and Titanium Grey. Launch offers include free accidental and liquid damage protection for six months, cashback options, and various financing schemes.

Article Title: Cognizant Americas EVP clarifies on Rs 2.5 lakh annual package: Our compensation for engineering graduates is ...
Article Text: IT giant Cognizant has found itself in the crosshairs of social media criticism over its salary packages. The company has clarified that the much-discussed (or rather much-trolled) Rs 2.52 lakh annual salary offer is intended for non-engineering undergraduate degree holders, and not for engineering graduates.Contrary to the social media uproar, Cognizant asserts that its starting salary for fresh engineering graduates ranges from Rs 4 lakh to Rs 12 lakh annually, depending on several factors like specialization and certifications.The company has emphasized that its compensation for engineering graduates is competitive with industry standards and even surpasses those of some peers."Our recent job posting for talent from non-engineering backgrounds, with a 3-year undergraduate degree has been grossly misrepresented. This job posting, with compensation of Rs 2.52 lakhs annually, was only for candidates with a 3-year undergraduate degree and not for engineering graduates."Our annual compensation for fresh engineering graduates ranges from Rs 4 lakhs to Rs 12 lakhs annually, depending on the category of hiring, skill set, and advanced industry accredited certifications," said Surya Gummadi, EVP and President, Cognizant Americas ."The compensation we offer for engineering graduates is highly competitive within the IT services peer group," he said. He said Cognizant has been recruiting and upskilling freshers from engineering institutions as well as colleges offering degrees in science, arts, and commerce."We have been recruiting and upskilling freshers from engineering institutions as well as colleges offering degrees in science, arts, and commerce. Today, as AI increasingly powers modern businesses, we are creating new pathways for talent to thrive in India's technology industry," Gummadi further said.Talking of Cognizant's India operation, Gummadi said, "India is the heart of Cognizant and its largest talent hub - with over 70 per cent of its over 3,36,000 global workforce - based in major metros and Tier-2 cities, across the country."
Article Summary: IT giant Cognizant has found itself in the crosshairs of social media criticism over its salary packages. The company has clarified that the much-discussed (or rather much-trolled) Rs 2.52 lakh annual salary offer is intended for non- engineering undergraduate degree holders.
